projects.name: Climeworks

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project removes carbon from atmosphere for geologic sequestration in mineral form. Pilot project in Iceland.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Minimal justificaiton provided; low ratio likely depends on availability of low-carbon energy in Iceland.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Successful mineralization produces reliable, effectively permanent carbon storage.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: Project is already fully subscribed, so any new investments are better construed as investments in future projects rather than fully additional procurements.

projects.description: Climeworks captures CO2 with direct air capture technology and permanently removes it from the atmosphere.

projects.name: CarbonCure

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project removes carbon from the atmophere for sequestration in mineralized building materials. No specific project identified in this application; CarbonCure identifies 200 cement production facilities using its technology and appears to be offering volume across this portfolio. CarbonCure expects 60,000 tCO2 removed in 2020 and another 60,000 tCO2 removed across all previous years.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: CarbonCure reports 1 tCO2 utilized leads to 0.85 tCO2 mineralized and 0.15 tCO2 emitted. CarboCulture also reports an additional 44.45 tCO2 in avoided emissions arising from its product replacing conventional concrete. Using the full set of removed and avoided emissions, the net negativity ratio is reported at 0.0033.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Successful mineralization produces reliable, effectively permanent carbon storage.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: Project appears to be monetizing the environmental attributes of cement already sold to others.

projects.description: Unlocking 500 Megatonnes of scalable, cost-effective carbon reductions in concrete

projects.name: Nori

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Projects remove carbon from the atmosphere for sequestration in soils. Volumes calculated using USDA COMET-Farm model, using project-level data collected by Nori. Volumes offered across 10 individual projects, some of which have sold some of their volumes to other buyers.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Nori does not report any data for this paramenter. This infromation should be available, however, in order to calculate the volume of tons on offer. Nori guarantees that the net negativity ratio will be less than 1.0 for all projects.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Soil carbon storage can be reversed by changes to land use or management practices. Nori requires a 10-year contractual commitment from its projects.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: Changes to land management practices not specified; significant co-benefits to land managers claimed alongside climate benefits offered for sale.

projects.description: Accelerating carbon removal and supporting soil health across US croplands.

projects.name: IndigoAg

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Projects remove carbon from the atmosphere for sequestration in soils. No details provided on specific projects. Carbon crediting methodology from Verra not specified; carbon crediting methodology from Climate Action Reserve not yet released in draft form for initial public comment.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: No information provided.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Soil carbon storage can be reversed by changed land practices, but IndigoAg provides no information about the duration of contractual or other legal obligations to maintain soil carbon practices. Project cites two protocol development processes ongoing at the Climate Action Reserve and Verra, but neither was complete at the time of project application.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: Changes to land management practices not specified; significant co-benefits to land managers claimed alongside climate benefits offered for sale.

projects.description: Soil carbon sequestration through regenerative farming practices at scale

projects.name: Biorecro

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project avoids emissions from biogenic carbon sources to atmosphere and instead captures that carbon for geologic sequestration in rocks' pore space. No details provided on specific projects. Project scale reasonable given technology.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: No information provided on projects. Lifecycle emisisons does not include injection, appears to exclude biogenic CO2 emissions not captured from production process. Injection not included. Possible use for enhanced oil recovery, which affects overall lifecycle emissions.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Successful geologic sequestration produces reliable, effectively permanent carbon storage.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: No detail provided. BECCS projects are likely additioinal, but additionality depends on the economics of any applicable tax credits or policy incentives.

projects.description: Bio-Energy with Carbon Capture and Storage

projects.name: Carbo Culture

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project avoids emissions from biomass resources and transforms them into long-lived biochar materials. Demonstration project in California's central valley, converting walnut shell waste into biochar.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Biogenic CO2 emissions excluded from net negativity ratio.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Standard biochar permanence considerations apply.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: Feedstock is walnut shells that are otherwise dumped on the ground or on roads, e.g. for dust reduction purposes. No analysis provided of competing uses for feedstock.
metrics.counterfactual: Walnut shells dumped on ground or burned in biomass electricity plant.

projects.description: Turning woody biomass waste into stable, high-purity biochar

projects.name: Droneseed

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project removes carbon from atmosphere for sequestration in forests. Volumes computed using Climate Action Reserve's Climate Forward Reforestation Forecast Methodology Version 1.0. Projected 100-year removal for project is 64,031 tCO2, with 584 tCO2 occuring in 2020.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: The reported ratio is based on sequestration only in 2020, but over its full lifetime the project is projected to reduce 64,031 tCO2, which would increase its ratio to 1.000.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Standard forest carbon permanence risk considerations apply.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: Can reasonably be considered an investment in a new technology to lower the cost of reforestation and aforestation, rather than an investment in a particular project.
metrics.counterfactual: Reforestation to occur manually or not at all.

metrics.name: cost
metrics.comment: Droneseed reported its cost per tCO2 using only the small share of expected total project carbon removal expected in 2020 (584 tCO2). Looking just at these expected climate benefits, Droneseed calculates a cost of $500.20/tCO2. Over the lifetime of this specific project, however, Droneseed estimates that 64,031 tCO2 will be removed from the atmosphere. We have adjusted the reported $/tCO2 value to reflect standard industry practice of using total expected benefits across the project's lifetime in order to facilitate comparison with similar forestry projects.

projects.description: Reforesting landscapes via heavy-lift drone swarms and science-based seed enablement

projects.name: Pachama

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Projects include both avoided emissions of carbon from forests as well as removal of atmospheric for sequestration in forests and forest products. Estimated sequestration rates in 2020 are reasonable, but the estimate for Rip's Redwoods has been identical over five years and that does not imply the use of remote-sensing based verification of project tons.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Self-reported value appears unreasonably high, but information is not available to independently calculate. Based on project type, we would expect a higher (more favorable) negativity ratio.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Standard forest carbon permanence risk considerations apply.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: Guanare afforestation project began in 2006. Rip's Redwood project already credited for standing carbon stock above regional baseline, which indicates a promise not to harvest normally and therefore raises questions about the additionality of ongoing carbon removal credits.
metrics.counterfactual: Counterfactual scenarios specified for both projects.

projects.description: Reforestation Projects Verified and Monitored with Satellite and Machine Learning

projects.name: Ocean-based

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project removes carbon from atmosphere via sequestration in phytoplankton and transport of phytoplankton biomass to deep ocean. Demonstration project to be deployed offshore California or Hawaii. Project volume based on expected carbon removal over five years.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Project emissions specified in detail.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Carbon dioxide removed to lower ocean depths can be stable for millenia, but ultimately is destined to affect ocean acidity and to be exposed to surface-atmosphere interactions over the very long run. Unlike geologic storage this stock has an implied end date for effectivess, albeit a potentially very distant one.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: The only reason to implement a project like this is to generate climate benefits, and no such projects are operating today.

projects.description: Leveraging biogeochemistry, our wave-powered upwelling/downwelling technology achieves long-term CO2​ ​ sequestration.

projects.name: Soil Value Exchange

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Projects remove carbon from the atmosphere for sequestration in soils. Specific projects not identified; applicant projects 10-30 individual landowners would be needed for this volume.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Reported ratio is only provisional, with amended results to be determined in a future study. No clear connection expressed between detailed, project-level expectations and promised future study. Net LCA impacts depend crucially on methane emissions from livestock; no GWP conversion information reported.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Soil carbon storage can be reversed by changed land management practices. Soil Value Exchange suggests that carbon storage could last 1000 years or more, but only requires 10-year contractual commitments. The contractual commitment provides a reasonable assurance of a 10-year horizon.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: No information provided about participating projects and their past practices.
metrics.counterfactual: Conventional grazing and intensive feedlot grazing discussed as alternative ranching practices, but no projects identified and no historical practices identified at specific project sites.

projects.description: Stripe negative emission purchase launches grassland ecology regeneration at scale

projects.name: GreenSand

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project removes carbon from atmosphere for geologic sequestration in mineral form. Volume is calculated based on expected weathering over 100 years, not removal in a single year.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Project-level analysis is conducted for a different project than the one on offer.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Successful mineralization produces reliable, effectively permanent carbon storage.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: Carbon removal certificates are offered separately from the olivine sand purchase; because olivine sand will be purchased and used, with the reported use indicated on certificate.
metrics.counterfactual: Alternative rocks used without carbon removal benefits.

projects.description: CO2 removal with Olivine

projects.name: SilviaTerra

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Projects remove carbon from atmosphere by extending time between forest harvests, sequestering carbon in forests and forest products. Projects sourced from 11 southern U.S. states via deferring timber harvests to increase carbon stored in forests.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Emissions created only from a small central office and field team in order to support the company's entire range of forest carbon products.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: SilviaTerra uses a distinct model where carbon stored in forests is guaranteed on an annual contract basis, denominated in ton-years of CO2.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: By shifting to a ton-year accounting framework, SilviaTerra intends to avoid additionality concerns by measuring actual carbon stored each year. However, other factors, such as exogenous shifts in timber markets, can still affect additionality considerations with respect to forest harvest decisions. Proprietary methods for measurement and verification against field plots were not available at the time of this proposal.
metrics.counterfactual: Counteractual scenario is active forest product harvest.

metrics.name: cost
metrics.comment: SilviaTerra uses a ton-year accounting that reflects the cost per tCO2 stored per year. Thus, a contract to store 10 tCO2 for 1 year at $15/tCO2-year would cost $150 and a contract to store 10 tCO2 for 100 years would cost $15,000.

projects.description: Empowering every landowner to participate in forest carbon rental markets

projects.name: Breadtree Farms

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project removes carbon from atmosphere for sequestration in forest carbon. Volumes calculated using USDA COMET-Planner model (56 tCO2) and Eric Toensmeier's The Carbon Farming Solution (Chelsea Green Books, 2016) (140 tCO2).

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Unclear whether livestock emissions are included in silvopasture expansion.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Land is owned by project proponent. Standard forest carbon permanence risk considerations apply.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: No analysis conducted in project proposal.

projects.description: Conversion of annual cropland to sheep/chestnut silvopasture

projects.name: Ecoera

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project avoids emissions from biomass resources and transforms them into long-lived biochar materials. Biochar produced from established production facility.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Project uses low-carbon electricity from the Nordic grid for pelletizing and pyrolysis.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Independent analysis of oxygen : carbon ratio of biochar is 0.039. Project asserts that a ratio < 0.2 implies a half-life of 1000 years. 500 years selected as conservative estimate.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: Feedstock is agricultural (seed) waste. No analysis provided of competing uses for feedstock.

projects.description: Biochar production from PYREG P500 and PYREG P1500

projects.name: Finnish Log House Industry Association

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project avoids emissions from biomass and sequesters carbon in building materials. Volume sourced from multiple facilities across Finland.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Based on Puro.earth verification. Numbers reported here only for raw materials through production stage (A1-A3), excluding transport of finished materials and construction-related emissions (A4-A5).

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Carbon is stored in building materials.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: No specific analysis provided.
metrics.counterfactual: Biomass resources would otherwise decompose or be used to generate heat or electrical energy.

projects.description: Laminated log production from lumber feedstock with CO2 sequestration certified by Puro

projects.name: Ekovilla

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project avoids emissions from biomass and sequesters carbon in building materials. Volume sourced from multiple facilities across Finland.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Based on Puro.earth verification.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Carbon is stored as wood-based insultation for buildings.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: Existing industry has been in produciton since the 1980s.

projects.description: Ekovilla’s net-negative products - emission neutralization with carbon removal

projects.name: Carbofex

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project avoids emissions from biomass resources and transforms them into long-lived biochar materials. Volume sourced from a biochar facility in Finland.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Based on Puro.earth verification; however, Puro.earth verification reports a different removal rate (3.11 kgCO2 removed per kg biochar). Excludes 1.69 kg CO2 emissions from biogenic sources per kg biochar; only fossil CO2 emissions included.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Carbofex projects that carbon will be stored for between 100 and 5000 years.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: Feedstock is residual wood (thinnings). No analysis provided of competing uses for feedstock.

projects.description: Biochar and carbon negative energy

projects.name: Vandersanden

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project removes carbon from atmosphere and sequesters in mineralized building materials; project also displaces need for carbon-emitting production processes for substitute, conventinal building materials. Volume is based on initial production of 100 tons of underlying product.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Project provides a range of outcomes but no specifics, noting the process can be adjusted to produce different levels of carbon removal relative to emissions.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: No specifics provided.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: Project involves initial production from carbon negative building materials using relatively expensive CO2 inputs (€75/tCO2).

projects.description: Development, production and sales of Facing Bricks and Slips by Carbonation

projects.name: Future Forest

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project removes carbon from atmosphere for sequestration in forest and soil carbon stocks. Volume projected for a single, 174-hectare land project in Scotland.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Emission calculations based on one-time planting and fencing emissions amortized over 60 years, various ongoing operations including raising pigs, and average annual sequestration in soil and forest carbon. Projected soil and forest carbon benefits are precisely equal at 3190 tCO2/year.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Project involves both soil and forest carbon. Standard forest carbon and soil permanence risk considerations apply.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: No analysis conducted in project proposal.
metrics.counterfactual: Counterfactual scenario not specified, but appears to involve "degraded" land remaining degraded.

projects.description: Commercially scalable, high-quality, transparent reforestation offset model in a developed economy.

projects.name: Carbon Sequestration Inc

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project avoids biomass emissions by burying wood waste in covered pits. Volume is based on wood waste (slash) to be stored in partially above-ground sealed pits.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Reported net removal (64,215 tCO2) does not match net removal calculated from reported components (64,332 tCO2).

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Project would store biological material in partially above-ground pits; risk of emission leakage, anaerobic decomposition not addressed comprehensively.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: No commercial value to storing wood waste in pits. However, no analysis provided of alternative feedstock uses such as bioenergy.

projects.description: Carbon sequestration via logging and wood burial

projects.name: Bluesource Doe Mountain

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project avoids emissions from forest carbon and removes carbon from the atmosphere for sequestration in forest carbon. Improved forest management project on 8,485 acres on state-owned land in Tennessee. Project is projected to generate 770,543 tCO2 beneifts, the dominant majority of which (545,254 tCO2 or 71%) are avoided emissions from forest harvesting. An 18% risk buffer pool is set aside to mitigate against potential reversals, producing a net expected removal of 631,845 tCO2. No specific method for calculating forest carbon benefits identified; buffer pool calculated using American Carbon Registry methods.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Removal reported as net of 18% buffer pool; project-level emissions reflect monitoring emissions

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Project appears to occur over 40 year-period. Project asserts that there is an 82% likelihood of "permanent" carbon storage, which is implausible given risks of forest carbon over long time horizons. Standard forest carbon permanence risk considerations apply.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: By the end of 2020, 56% of total project climate benefits will have been earned via avoided harvest. Thus, the project has already committed to avoid harvest and therefore the expected carbon removal is later years is already assured.
metrics.counterfactual: Counterfactual scenario is harvest of most forest carbon over the period 2018-2021.

projects.description: This project protects the carbon stock in the forest.

projects.name: Rizome

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project removes carbon from atmosphere for sequestration in bamboo and bamboo building materials. Volume projected using unspecified Verified Carbon Standard protocol.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Minimal information reported.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Project projects permanence of 80 years for bamboo clumps and 50-100 years for engineered wood products.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: Project claims that bamboo building materials have reached parity with conventional wood products. This suggests bamboo planting may not require climate policy incentives. No analysis of competing economics of conventional wood products, alternative land management options.
metrics.counterfactual: Counterfactual not specified. Project appears to target degraded land and suggests alternative land uses, such as native forest plantations, might be feasible but would produce lower overall carbon removal services due to bamboo's extremely high annual productivity.

projects.description: The largest giant bamboo reforestation project on earth + engineered lumber

projects.name: Vesta

metrics.name: volume
metrics.comment: Project removes carbon from the atmosphere for sequestration in the ocean in mineral form. Volume projected based on total crushed olivine supply to pilot project site.

metrics.name: negativity
metrics.comment: Project reports 49 kg CO2 emitted per ton of olivine produced and 1.25 tCO2 removed per ton of olivine produced. Project claims higher negativity ratio by using wave energy to displace secondary and tertiary grinding of olivine to small particles needed for carbon removal.

metrics.name: permanence
metrics.comment: Successful mineralization produces reliable, effectively permanent carbon storage.

metrics.name: additionality
metrics.comment: Project would only be pursued for carbon removal purposes; no intrinsic commerical value.

projects.description: Accelerate olivine weathering with wave power for carbon dioxide removal.
